item.description:
Cherry Mountain lies a few miles west of the Presidential Range in north-central New Hampshire. This should be an excellent summit to view foliage. The summit of Owls Head (the north peak of Cherry Mountain), elevation 3,263 feet, provides excellent views of the Presidentials, Crawford Notch, and the peaks surrounding Franconia Notch. Cherry Mountain, consisting of Mount Martha (3573'), Owl's Head (3258'). A moderate hike round trip of 5.7 miles/2350' elevation gain/allow 5 hours.

Meeting Times:
8:30 AM Carpool Depart from Hannaford parking lot Concord NH/Exit 14 off I-93
10:30 AM Cherry Mtn Trailhead a couples miles from Rte 115 Junction with Rte 3 Whitefield NH 03595

Note: There are 2 trailheads along 115 that relate to Cherry Mountain. One is called
Cherry Mountain Slide a about 5-6 miles in along 115 and easily visible from the road and takes you first to Owlâ€™s Head. We are NOT meeting there. We are meeting at the first trailhead parking area which is on the right a couple miles up 115 and is set above an embankment and thus difficult to see. If you reach the Cherry Mountain Slide Trail turn around and head back toward Twin Mountain and look on your left for the hiking trailhead sign on a gravel drive at the embankment and that is Cherry Mountain Trailhead.
item.how_to_find_us: Will have sign NEHM on windshield
item.name: Columbus Day Cherry Mtn Hike
